revised_title: Hygrometric Methods: Saturation, Chemical Method, and Dew-Point Instruments
tldr: This report examines various hygrometric methods, including saturation and chemical methods, and dew-point instruments. The authors discuss the efficiency of drying tubes, the effects of air passing through apparatus containing dew-point instruments, and the accuracy of chemical methods compared to tabulated vacuum pressures. They also analyze the behavior of nearly saturated air and its impact on hygrometric measurements.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
